A transaction type is linked to the security type by choosing the desired transaction type from the left-hand side listing and pressing the >> button, when the transaction type is moved to the linked transaction types listing on the right-hand side. Similarly, a transaction type can be removed from the linked transaction types by choosing it from the right-hand side listing and pressing the << button. Only the transaction types linked to a security can be chosen as the transaction type of the transaction created to the security type.

title: Security types
body: Subtype

title: Security types
body: The sub types defined for the security type. The subtypes are more detailed description of the basic security types: for example, a security type bond could have subtypes fixed rate bond, floating rate note, convertible bond and government bond. The sub types are listed in this section: subtypes can be modified with the Modify button below the subtype listing.

title: Security types
body: The security type is saved with the Save button below the fields.

title: Security types
body: Changes in security types are audited - user audit tracks changes users make in Security type Preferences. Every time a user makes a change in security types, user audit contains a message ”User [username] created/modified/deleted security type [code]”. (Available from FA 3.9 onward)

title: Characteristics of Basic types
body: Security's Basic type determines what kind of fields are available in the Security window and Transaction window for creating this type of a security or when creating transactions for this type of a security, controls how the security type is handled when calculating your portfolio's positions, and controls where the security is selectable within the system. The table below summarizes the built-in characteristics of the available Basic types.

title: Settlement place
body: In the Settlement place preferences you can define the settlement places available for securities and transactions. The settlement place tells, where a transaction (or a security) is settled. For example, the settlement places can include settlements such as Euroclear.

title: Settlement place
body: Settlement places can be defined in the Settlement place window in the Preferences. A settlement place consists of a code and a name: the code is used to identify the settlement place in the system (if using for example SWIFT messages, define the valid BIC code for the settlement place), and the name is used to view and choose the settlement place in the user interface.

title: Fund wizard
body: The Fund wizard lets you set up a fund or edit settings for an existing fund in FA Fund Management app. When you set up a fund in the FA Fund management app, FA creates a fund portfolio with the specified properties in FA Back to store the fund information and manage fund investments.

title: Fund wizard
body: To set up a new fund, click the Add fund button at the top-right of the NAV status view. To view and edit the settings of an existing fund, click the Edit fund button in the Fund details pane.

title: Fund wizard
body: The Fund wizard fields are described below.

title: Basic info tab
body: The Basic info tab contains the basic information about the fund.

title: Basic info tab
body: Fund company*

title: Basic info tab
body: A company the fund is administered by. Choose the company from the list of contacts available in FA Back.

title: Basic info tab
body: Language*

title: Basic info tab
body: The language to be used in portfolio reports. If the language is filled in the fund company's contact in FA Back, it is automatically copied to the Fund wizard when you set up a fund.

title: Basic info tab
body: Juridical*

title: Basic info tab

title: Basic info tab

title: Basic info tab

title: Basic info tab
body: ID*

title: Basic info tab
body: A unique fund ID used to identify the fund and search for funds. Best practice is not to include special characters in the ID – only use numbers and letters (a-z).

title: Basic info tab
body: Currency*

title: Basic info tab

title: Basic info tab

title: Basic info tab
body: Valuation method for the fund portfolio:

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Average price with separate items – Valuates portfolio with average price, but keeps track of original purchase dates.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO (combined) – Valuates the portfolio based directly on transactions in the subportfolios.

title: Basic info tab
body: FIFO with adjustments – Uses transaction types that control the market value of the positions with the transaction's trade amount, such as Private Equity transaction types.

title: Basic info tab
body: Type*

title: Basic info tab
body: Portfolio type. Choose the type that corresponds to the fund portfolio.

title: Cash accounts
body: Cash accounts for the fund.

title: Cash accounts
body: Name*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account name.

title: Cash accounts
body: Currency*

title: Cash accounts
body: Account currency.

title: Cash accounts
body: Account number*

title: Cash accounts
body: The account number, for example the bank account number.

title: Cash accounts
body: Set as default account

title: Cash accounts
body: Set account as the default account of the portfolio. All transactions are by default created against this account.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: The NAV schedules tab contains schedule settings for calculating NAV, fees, and unofficial NAV for the fund. Schedules let you track your fund's status. For example, you can see if NAV or fees have to be calculated today. You need to fill the dates only once. After that, dates are updated every time you accept the calculation.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: NAV schedules tab features settings for different workflows. You can set a schedule to calculate:

title: NAV schedules tab
body: NAV and fees as a part of regular NAV calculation workflow.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Fees, in addition to the regular NAV calculation schedule, between the regular NAV calculation dates (to set a schedule for this workflow, click Add separate fee calculation schedule).

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Unofficial NAV for reporting purposes between the scheduled regular NAV calculations (to set a schedule for this workflow, click Add unofficial NAV calculation schedule).

title: NAV schedules tab
body: To learn more about calculation workflows, see Workflows and NAV statuses.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Frequency

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Calculation frequency.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Holiday calendar

title: NAV schedules tab
body: The holiday calendar to take into account in the calculation schedule. If you don't find a suitable holiday calendar from the list, you can create a calendar in FA Back (for details, see Holiday calendar in the FA Back reference).

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Roll convention

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Calculation schedule based on the day of the month or day of the week. One of the most common roll conventions is "EOM" (end-of-month).

title: NAV schedules tab
body: You set the calculation frequency to "Every three months" and the first calculation date is on June 30th. The calculation dates will fall on the 30th of each month (September 30th, December 30th, March 30th, and so on). For months with 31 days, the calculation date won't be the last day of the month. If you choose the "End of Month (EOM)" roll convention, the system will recognize that June 30th is the last day of the month, and the calculation dates will fall on the last day of each month (September 30th, December 31st, March 31st, and so on).

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Business day convention

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Business day convention determines how to adjust a date if it falls on a non-business day.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: First NAV date

title: NAV schedules tab
body: The date for which NAV is calculated for the first time.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Previous NAV date

title: NAV schedules tab
body: The date for which the latest NAV was calculated. For the newly created fund, previous NAV date must be the same as the first NAV date.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Calculation delay in days

title: NAV schedules tab
body: The number of days between the NAV date and the calculation date. Enter "0" to calculate NAV ont he same date, or choose the number of days to calculate NAV with a delay.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Calculate next days

title: NAV schedules tab
body: The button sets the next NAV date and calculation dates according to the information entered above.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Next NAV date

title: NAV schedules tab

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Previous calculation date

title: NAV schedules tab

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Next calculation date

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Next calculation date based on the next NAV date and calculation delay

title: Fee structure tab
body: The Fee structure tab lets you set or edit the fees applied to the whole fund. Click the Add fee button to add more than one fee formula.

title: Fee structure tab

title: Fee structure tab
body: Fee formula

title: Fee structure tab

title: Fee structure tab

title: Fee structure tab

title: Fee structure tab

title: Fee structure tab

title: Fee structure tab

title: Fee structure tab
body: Include in income distribution

title: Fee structure tab
body: Include the fee in the income distribution calculation.

title: Fee structure tab
body: Include fees calculated since the previous NAV calculation date in the current NAV calculation (if fees are calculated separately from NAV).

title: Fee structure tab

title: Fee structure tab
body: Allocate fees per share class from the beginning of the fund (for example, for private equity funds).

title: Fee structure tab
body: Calculate fees per share class since the beginning of the fund (not since the latest NAV calculation). To learn more, see NAV calculation.

title: Fund reporting tab
body: The Fund reporting tab lets you define the settings to produce fund reporting data, including fund KPIs, and store it in the FA Fund Management app (see Fund reporting view for details). Click Enable fund reporting and fill in the fields.

title: Fund reporting tab
body: Reporting schedule

title: Fund reporting tab
body: The settings for the fund reporting schedule are similar to the NAV schedules (see NAV schedules tab).

title: Fund reporting tab
body: Allocation groups

title: Fund reporting tab
body: Allocation groups to analyze the fund portfolio contents. To learn more about allocations, see Allocation in the FA Back reference.

title: Order execution tab
body: The Order execution tab lets you define and edit the automatic trade order execution settings.

title: Order execution tab
body: Cut-off time

title: Order execution tab
body: The cut-off time for the fund in 24 h format, for example, “13:00”. After you set the cut-off time, you can use decision tables make sure that certain transactions or trade orders that come after the cut-off time don't affect the NAV calculation. To learn more, see Set up a mutual fund.

title: Cash transactions for the fund
body: Transaction types for bookkeeping

title: Cash transactions for the fund
body: For bookkeeping purposes, you can provide transaction types that are used when creating cash transaction for client orders whose settlement date doesn’t follow the default logic.

title: NAV reporting tab
body: The NAV reporting tab features custom templates for the NAV reports. If you have custom NAV reports, enter the template paths and template names in the fields. Example path: "/NAV/NAV Report".

title: Swing pricing
body: The Swing pricing tab lets you define the settings for swing pricing. Click Apply swing pricing and fill in the fields.

title: Swing percentage
body: Swing percentage is the swing factor used to adjust the unit price with.

title: Swing percentage
body: For swinging up

title: Swing percentage

title: Swing percentage
body: For swinging down

title: Swing percentage
body: The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net outflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Thresholds
body: Swing thresholds are the net inflow or net outflow of the fund that triggers the adjustment to the NAV. You can set a threshold in the fund currency or as a percentage of the fund's NAV.

title: Thresholds
body: For swinging up

title: Thresholds
body: Net inflow that triggers swinging up

title: Thresholds
body: For swinging down

title: Thresholds

title: Income distribution
body: The Income distribution tab lets you define the settings for income distribution. The income distribution components are calculated based on the balances of the specified bookkeeping accounts on the NAV date.

title: Income distribution
body: Click Enable income distribution and fill in the fields.

title: Income distribution
body: Accounts

title: Income distribution
body: Fields for bookkeeping accounts. To enter multiple account numbers, separate them with semicolon. To include only part of the account balance in the calculation, enter a percentage after the account number. For example, "123456=45,5" means that 45,5% of the 123456 account balance is used in the calculation.

title: Income distribution
body: Mark all “Ready” bookkeeping postings from start of the year to the NAV date as “Reported” when NAV is accepted

title: Income distribution
body: Change the status of bookkeeping postings produced by income distribution when the NAV is accepted. In most cases, you need to have this option selected.

title: Breakdown of income distribution in cash transactions
body: Tax and cost types to show in the transaction fields (this selection is available only if you have automatic order execution selected).

title: Breakdown of income distribution in cash transactions
body: These settings let you define the transaction cost types to show in the Par value cost type, Over/ under cost type , Income distribution tax type, Swing tax type fields of the fund transaction.

title: Accounting
body: The Accounting tab lets you define accounts and rules for posting generation.

title: Accounting
body: Automated deferral runs before NAV calculation

title: Accounting
body: Settings for deferral runs before NAV calculation. To run deferrals before every NAV calculation, you need to have this functionality enabled in FA. Choose the deferral type to run and the previous deferral date. If the previous deferral date is empty, the starting date of the fund is used.

title: Accounting

body: The Advanced settings tab contains miscellaneous settings for your fund.

title: Unit certificates

title: Pricing of share class without shareholders

title: Allocation
body: Select the checkbox and choose the allocation groups to update share class allocations based on fund portfolio contents when you accept NAV. Allocations are updated for the configured group(s), based on fund portfolio’s allocations on the NAV date.

title: Characteristics of Basic types
body: Basic type Security window Transaction window Position calculation

title: Characteristics of Basic types
body: STOCK All standard security fields available.

title: Characteristics of Basic types
body: BOND All standard security fields available. All Extra info fields available.

title: Characteristics of Basic types
body: OPTION All standard security fields available. Selected Extra info fields available at the top of the tab.

title: Characteristics of Basic types
body: FUTURE All standard security fields available. Selected Extra info fields available at the top of the tab.

Security types based on DISCOUNT are also used when the system stores future cashflows on FX Contracts. Such securities are created automatically, and certain fields are disabled - more details. You can also create DISCOUNT securities manually.

title: Characteristics of Basic types
body: DEPOSIT All standard security fields available. All Extra info fields available.

title: Characteristics of Basic types

title: Characteristics of Basic types

title: Characteristics of Basic types

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 1 tr.parentPortfolio Yes Portfolio ID String (unique ID of the transaction's portfolio)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 2 tr.extId Transaction External ID External ID / number of you transaction. If left empty, an external ID is generated for the transaction by the system. In addition, system defines an internal ID as well. External ID is used in combination with #1 Portfolio ID to update existing transactions - if your external ID already exists, the existing transaction is updated.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 3 tr.type Yes Type Type code (configured in the system). E.g. buy, sell etc.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 4 tr.status Yes Status Define as a code: OK = Accepted DEL = Deleted NF = Not finished

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 5 tr.transactionDate Yes Transaction date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 6 tr.settlementDate No Settlement date yyyy-MM-dd In addition, you can use numbers between 1 and 99 to set the settlement date (the settlement date is set the inserted number of business days after the transaction date). The transaction's security's (or cash transaction's currency's) holiday calendar is used to determine which days are business days.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 7 tr.maturityDate No Maturity date Not used. Only available for transactions on securities with base type DEPOSIT (not regular deposit transactions). Use format yyyy-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 8 tr.security No Security Security code of the transaction's security. Leave empty, if a cash transaction. In addition to security code, importing transactions is supported with ISIN code, trade code or update codes 1 through 3. When importing transactions by using ISIN code to identify the security, the system checks that the transaction’s currency (column #11 Currency) matches the found security’s currency, if there are multiple securities with the same ISIN code in the system.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 9 tr.securityType No Security type Security type code of the transaction's security's type (as configured in the system). Used to determine features of a transaction.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 10 tr.account No Account Account number, if transaction is directed to an account. You can use the an account linked to the portfolio or shared to the portfolio. Define AUTO to record the transactions to the account with the same currency as the transaction, if such an account is found, or to the default account of the portfolio, if suitable currency account is not found. Define DEFAULT to always direct the transaction to the portfolio's default account. The system ignores white spaces in account numbers, and is thus able to recognize account numbers (such as IBAN numbers) defined with or without white spaces.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 11 tr.currency No Currency Transaction's currency (define with the currency code). If you don't define a currency for your transaction, the system will automatically determine it based on your transaction's data (available from FA 3.9 onward). Transaction's currency is either 1) Transaction's security's currency (if transaction is linked to a security) 2) Transaction's account's currency (for transactions not linked to a security but linked to account, i.e. CASH transactions) 3) Transaction's portfolio's currency (for transactions not linked to a security nor account, i.e. CASH transactions with "No account") After 3.9, best practice is to leave the currency empty, and the system will determine it for you. Before FA 3.9, transaction's currency was a mandatory field: define the currency with the currency security's code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 12 tr.amount Yes Amount Number of units. Amount field only accepts the amount of decimals defined for the security type or as the block size of the security: if your file has more decimals in the amount, the amount is rounded to contain only accepted amount of decimals. If number of units is not available, you can leave it empty, when the system calculates the amount with "unitPrice" (#13) and "tradeAmount" (#14).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 13 tr.unitPrice Yes Unit price Unit price is security currency (trade currency). Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. For bonds, unit price can be set with % (e.g. 3.45%), when the system calculates the price according to YTM automatically. If unit price is not available or it is inaccurate, you can leave it empty, when the system calculates the unit price with "amount" (#12) and "tradeAmount" (#14).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 14 tr.tradeAmount Yes Trade amount Value of the transaction in security currency (trade currency), i.e. money value of the transaction including costs, taxes, accrued interest etc. If trade amount is not available, you can leave it empty, when the system calculates the trade amount with "amount" (#12) and "unitPrice" (#13).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 15 tr.fxRate No FX rate Exchange rate for the transaction. When importing an FX rate, the system automatically determines whether the exchange rate is account exchange rate (column #41) and/or report exchange rate (column #42), and fills them in appropriately. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 16 tr.tax No Tax Tax in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 17 tr.cost No Cost Fee in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 18 tr.cost2 No Cost 2 Credit fee in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 19 tr.origTransactionDate No Booked transaction date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 20 tr.origUnitPrice No Booked unit price Booked unit price in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 21 tr.origTradeAmount No Booked trade amount Booked trade amount. Define AUTO to automatically calculate the booked trade amount by multiplying the amount with transaction day's market data entry.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 22 tr.origFxRate No Booked FX rate Booked exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's report currency. Define AUTO to automatically use the original transaction day's market data entry.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 23 tr.accruedInterest No Accrued interest Accrued interest in trade currency. For bonds, the accrued interest can be set with "?", when the system calculates the accrued interest automatically. Define AUTO to automatically calculate the accrued interest.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 24 tr.reference No Reference Reference of the transaction, usually transaction's reference number. Reference is used in combination with #1 Portfolio ID to update existing transactions if you haven't defined #2 External ID in your import file - if your reference can be found from an existing transaction, the existing transaction is updated.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 25 tr.counter No Counter Counter (use contact ID)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 26 tr.counterPortfolio No Counter portfolio Counter portfolio (use portfolio code)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: (27) (Ext info) Not used. Use tr.description in column #31 instead.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 28 tr.intInfo No Internal info Internal transaction description

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 29 tr.basis No Basis Not used.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 30 tr.priority No Priority Intraday priority of a transaction. -1,1,2,3... The transaction with the lowest priority has the highest number defined in the priority field (0 is lower than 1 and -1 is lower than 0). The default priority is 0.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 31 tr.description No Description Description/comment on the transaction

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 32 tr.security2 No Security 2 Security code of the removed security (e.g. in the exchange, the one that is replaced)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 33 tr.ratio No Ratio Define the ratio with syntax x:x (e.g. 1:2 or 2:3.25). Ratio is used for example for splits and exchanges. For splits, define the ratio between the number of securities before and after the split (with ratio 1:2, one security before the split would become two securities after the split). For exchanges, define the ratio as how many new securities are received with one removed security (with ratio 1:2, one removed security would become two new securities after the exchange).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 34 tr.taxType No Tax type Tax type of the transaction defined with the tax type code

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 35 tr.marketPlace No Market place Use the exchange code / market place code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 36 tr.tradeTime No Trade time hh:mm:ss You can also define the trade time with time zone information with the syntax of hh:mm:ssContinent/City (e.g. 11:12:13Europe/Helsinki, use valid java time zones) - when the transaction is imported, the trade time is converted into the server's time zone.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 37 tr.tax2 No Tax 2 Tax in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 38 tr.taxType2 No Tax 2 type Tax type of the transaction defined with the tax type code

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 39 tr.tags No Tags Comma-separated list of tags. Tags import allows you to add new tags: Standalone tags are added with a <tag name>. For example: Fund,Urgent.Single-select group tags should be added as <group name>-<tag name>. For example: office-Helsinki. If a transaction already has a tag with the same group name, the tag is replaced.Multi-select group tags should be added as a comma-separated list of values <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: Campaign:EarlyBird,Campaign:Friends. If a transaction already has tags with the same group name, the new tag is added to the existing ones. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a tag value: Standalone tags: ---<tag name>. For example: ---Fund,---Urgent.Single-select group tags: ---<group name>-<tag name>. For example: —office-Helsinki.Multi-select group tags: ---<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: ---Campaign:EarlyBird,---Campaign:Friends. For details, see Removing transaction and trade order values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 40 tr.settlementPlace No Settlement place Use the settlement code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 41 tr.accountFxRate No Account FX rate Exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's account currency. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. If you are not sure whether you need account or report FX rate, use FX rate (column #15) instead, which automatically determines which one to use.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 42 tr.reportFxRate No Report FX rate Exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's report currency. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. If you are not sure whether you need account or report FX rate, use FX rate (column #15) instead, which automatically determines which one to use.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 43 tr.coefficient No Coefficient Coefficient calculated from the linked security's price and index base value. Affects trade amount same as unit price. Define AUTO to automatically calculate coefficient on the transaction date from the linked security and index base value.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 44 tr.compCost1 No Break-down of cost 1 Define the break-down of costs as a list of transaction cost data with the syntax <type>=<value>. Types are from defined transaction cost type. E.g. BROK=15,ADV=22. If you also defined a Cost (column #17), your Break-down of cost 1 has to sum up to the total cost you defined! If you leave Cost empty, the system calculates it automatically as the sum of your break-down of costs.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 45 tr.compCost2 No Break-down of cost 2 Define the break-down of costs as a list of transaction cost data with the syntax <type>=<value>. Types are from defined transaction cost type. E.g. BROK=15,ADV=22. If you also defined a Cost 2 (column #18), your Break-down of cost 2 has to sum up to the total cost you defined! If you leave Cost empty, the system calculates it automatically as the sum of your break-down of costs.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 46 tr.costType1 No Transaction cost type 1 Type of selected transaction cost type. Value is from defined transaction cost type's type code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 47 tr.costType2 No Transaction cost type 2 Type of selected transaction cost type. Value is from defined transaction cost type's type code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 48 tr.hidden No Hidden Whether the transaction should be marked as hidden. Define as a number: 1 = Hidden 0 = Not hidden (default)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 49 tr.paymentDate No Payment date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 50 tr.accrual No Accrual Transaction's accrual, or the the paid/received accrued income which is recorded as part of the price (unit price x amount). Accrual has no effect of the trade amount (Available from FA 3.7 onward)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: (51) (Execution method) Not used for transactions, available only for trade orders. Value 0 is always used for transactions, since transactions don't have an execution method

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Convention Description

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Following Move to the next valid business day.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Modified following (without crossing mid-month or month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is after the 15th of the month OR in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Modified following (without crossing month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Modified preceding (without crossing month start) Move to the previous valid business day, unless that is in the previous month in which case move to the next valid business day.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Nearest For Sunday and Monday, move to the next valid business day, for all other days, move to the previous valid business day.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: No adjustment Make no adjustment.

title: NAV schedules tab
body: Preceeding Move to the previous valid business day.
